[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Have you thought of any names for the kittens yet? 
I was considering naming one of them Oreo because she's black and white, what do you think of that name?
Very fitting. Great name for a black and white cat. I looked in adopting some kittens like you recommended. 
Rescuing animals is a great thing to do. But I wonder if the cats and your parrot would get along!
They might not get along but Tasha can hold her own. Plus I think she would get a kick out of watching them.
Haha. So have you been hiking lately? It's been a hot summer, I think it'd kill me!

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Living Environment and Pets', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B talks about living in the city and having a cat and a new kitten, while Speaker A mentions being a country girl and having a pet parrot named Tasha.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: I live in the city where I grew up and I love animals.. ### Speaker A: I love animals!! My pet parrot's name is tasha. ### Speaker B: I have a cat. She just had a kitten too!.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Adopting Kittens and Training Pets', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B talks about adopting out a rescue kitten, and Speaker A discusses adopting a kitten and training it to get along with the parrot.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Do you still want to adopt out your new resucue kitten? ### Speaker B: Yes, I have just finished filling out and submitting all of the adoption paperwork to the animal rescue. And good news, all kittens are feeling better and are healthy again. I love them. ### Speaker A: That's great news! Do you have any names picked out for them or are you going to keep their names? ### Speaker B: I do not have any names picked out for them yet. I have been trying to get to know their personalities better before I give them a name. Two of them are very spunky and one is shy. Maybe I will give them a Mandarin name! Do you have any recommendations as you are learning Mandarin? ### Speaker A: Hm, maybe Zhao for one of them! I always thought that name sounded cool ### Speaker B: Oh, how interesting! I have a friend who's surname is Zhao. What does Zhao mean in Mandarin? ### Speaker A: I believe it's just the name of a state, it doesn't really have a meaning.  ### Speaker B: Oh, okay. Are you able to adopt any cats since you have a parrot? I do not know if those two species get along. ### Speaker A: I can! My parrot would be fine with the extra friend, I would just need to train the kitten to see him as a friend rather than a foe, ha! ### Speaker B: I will pass on any training tips that I acquire as I train the new kittens. My older cat is so mellow that I have never had any issues training her. But two on the little kittens seem like they will be a handful to train. ' }
```
